fdm.fdm module¶

class fdm.fdm.FDM(grid, deriv, bound_estimator=<function _default_bound_estimator>, factor=1, step_max=1)[source]¶

Bases: object

A finite difference method.

Call the finite difference method with a function f, an input location x (optional: defaults to 0), and a step size (optional: defaults to an estimate) to estimate the derivative of f at x. For example, if m is an instance of fdm.FDM, then m(f, 1) estimates the derivative of f at 1.

Parameters

  • grid (list) – Relative spacing of samples of the function used by the method.

  • deriv (int) – Order of the derivative to estimate.

  • bound_estimator (function, optional) – Estimator that taken in a function f and a location x and gives back an estimate of an upper bound on the len(grid)`th order derivative of `f at x. Defaults to fdm._default_bound_estimator.

  • factor (float, optional) – Estimate of the relative error on function evaluations as a multiple of the machine epsilon. Defaults to 1.

  • step_max (float, optional) – Maximum step size, to prevent very large step sizes in the case of high-order methods. Defaults to 0.1.

grid¶

Relative spacing of samples of the function used by the method.

Type

list

order¶

Order of the estimator.

Type

int

deriv¶

Order of the derivative to estimate.

Type

int

eps¶

Estimated absolute round-off error of the function evaluation. This is used to estimate the step size.

Type

float

bound¶

Estimated upper bound of the absolute value of the function and all its derivatives. This is used to estimate the step size.

Type

float

coefs¶

Weighting of the samples used to estimate the derivative.

Type

list

step¶

Estimate of the step size. This estimate depends on eps and bound, and may be inadequate if eps and bound are inadequate.

Type

float

step_max¶

Maximum step size, to prevent very large step sizes in the case of high-order methods.

Type

float, optional

acc¶

Estimate of the accuracy of the method. This estimate depends on eps and bound, and may be inadequate if eps and bound are inadequate.

Type

float

estimate(f=None, x=0.0)[source]¶

Estimate step size and accuracy of the method.

Parameters

  • f (function, optional) – Function to estimate step size and accuracy for. Defaults to the constant function 1.

  • x (tensor, optional) – Location to estimate derivative at. Defaults to 0.

Returns

Returns itself.

Return type

fdm.FDM

fdm.fdm.forward_fdm(order, deriv, adapt=1, condition=100, **kw_args)[source]¶

Construct a forward finite difference method.

Further takes in keyword arguments of the constructor of fdm.FDM.

Parameters

  • order (int) – Order of the method.

  • deriv (int) – Order of the derivative to estimate.

  • adapt (int, optional) – Number of recursive calls to higher-order derivatives to dynamically determine the step size. Defaults to 1.

  • condition (float, optional) – Amplification of the infinity norm when passed to the function’s derivatives. Defaults to fdm.default_condition.

Returns

The desired finite difference method.

Return type

fdm.FDM

fdm.fdm.backward_fdm(order, deriv, adapt=1, condition=100, **kw_args)[source]¶

Construct a backward finite difference method.

Further takes in keyword arguments of the constructor of fdm.FDM.

Parameters

  • order (int) – Order of the method.

  • deriv (int) – Order of the derivative to estimate.

  • adapt (int, optional) – Number of recursive calls to higher-order derivatives to dynamically determine the step size. Defaults to 1.

  • condition (float, optional) – Amplification of the infinity norm when passed to the function’s derivatives. Defaults to fdm.default_condition.

Returns

The desired finite difference method.

Return type

fdm.FDM

fdm.fdm.central_fdm(order, deriv, adapt=1, condition=100, **kw_args)[source]¶

Construct a central finite difference method.

Further takes in keyword arguments of the constructor of fdm.FDM.

Parameters

  • order (int) – Order of the method.

  • deriv (int) – Order of the derivative to estimate.

  • adapt (int, optional) – Number of recursive calls to higher-order derivatives to dynamically determine the step size. Defaults to 1.

  • condition (float, optional) – Amplification of the infinity norm when passed to the function’s derivatives. Defaults to fdm.default_condition.

Returns

The desired finite difference method.

Return type

fdm.FDM

fdm.fdm.default_condition = 100¶

Default condition number.
